website_summaries.verdict: These feature-packed headphones are the ultimate choice for workouts and long runs.
pros: Up to 9 hours of playback per charge
Built-in volume and track controls on each piece

customer_reviews.title: after the rubber tip there is a huge black ball that hurts my ear badly
customer_reviews.text: sound is good not great because they don't get very loud. Keeps losing signal even though phone is in my hands. After the rubber tip there is a huge black ball that hurts my ear badly so you can't wear them for very long. you also don't get anything more from these 276$ headphones that you wouldn't get from a 100$ pair. I recommend going with something else.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Like better than my AirPods. However, there’s one potential issue... (read on)
customer_reviews.text: Love the deep sound. Really comfortable. Better fit and security than my “old” AirPods. Battery life excellent. Unfortunately I am experiencing random Bluetooth drops throughout the day between the Powerbeats Pro and my iPhone XS Max. Not sure why. Will monitor this Bluetooth situation and update this review in a couple months.
customer_reviews.author: Otter

customer_reviews.title: Totally free. Totally wireless. Lots of comfort.
customer_reviews.text: At 250$ it’s not a cheap pill to swallow But damnit. These things feel great. They don’t move. No wires. I take one headphone out and they pause. Controls on both sides. Hey siri support. Great battery life. I can work out with just one in. Doesn’t matter which ear. Speaking of working out. How many times have you deadlifted and snagged a wire? Not anymore satan! Handstand push-ups? Easy day! They’re just awesome. I pull them out of the case and my iPhone just connects
customer_reviews.author: Devin T. McFall

customer_reviews.title: Paying for only convenience
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion is worth the $250. But sound quality is almost the same from past products. Your just paying for the convenience and longer battery life
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: I wish better...
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine at first, then around a month into it, both headphones at full charge intermittently abruptly stop working for no apparent reason whatsoever. Intended on returning them but missed the window by 2 days. Brought them to Apple, told the Genius at the Genius Bar it's an intermittent issue, said Beats will likely replace them but not surprisingly, they returned the same headphones to me saying they didnt see the issue. Such a drag, because now Im stuck with crappy headphones I paid $200 for that at any moment, wont work. So disappointing, you may as well buy a wireless inexpensive headset that costs a fraction of that amount.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Haft

customer_reviews.title: WOW Terrible experience
customer_reviews.text: I received my new Power Beats pro and was excited. However they came defective and the right earpiece does not work! Very disappointed to pay such a high price for such a bad experience. And yes I followed the instructions to reset and repair several times
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THEM!!! OMG....just got these today....ordered them on 5/12. I have them in my ears right now....the sound is awesome....the fit is fantastic....super comfortable! I can't wait to try them out at the gym and on the trail!
customer_reviews.author: Txs

customer_reviews.title: It's All in the Ear Tips
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are great but I will say that the ear tips you choose makes all the difference. The original medium tips and dual level tips allowed a lot of leakage which killed all of the bass. Once I placed the large ear tips on, which fit my ears much better, the sound came alive and my satisfaction with the product was greatly improved. I highly recommend rotating through the ear pieces, even the one you don't think will fit (as were mine), until you find the best sound and comfort profile for you.
customer_reviews.author: Elisif the Fair

customer_reviews.title: Powerbeats Not Sold As New
customer_reviews.text: I literally just received these Powerbeats Pro and noticed that the packaging seemed a little off. I opened them up and tried to sync them to my phone, only to find that they used to belong to a ‘Rossanna’ (see attached picture). I also noticed a piece of ear wax on one of the ear tips (also pictured). It is absurd and deceptive to post an item; especially an expense item such as the Powerbeats Pro, as new, even though they have clearly been used. I returned immediately upon receiving.
customer_reviews.author: Batman82

customer_reviews.title: Dr. Dre used to have a lot more bass than these headphones..
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment! For $250, I expected much better sound from these headphones. The main issue I have is that there is virtually no bass and the midrange is barely existent, but wow, the high end is insane.. Ear bleeding insane. I don’t know how everyone on the reviews or on Amazon got theirs sounding so awesome, but mine sound like music played through a tin can. Would love to keep them but not if they are going to make my ears bleed.
customer_reviews.author: Wintrmte

customer_reviews.title: Good to go
customer_reviews.text: Rated 5 stars on all fronts because: - They stay put. I didn't have to stop once to pick these up during my walk. - They don't have any connecting wire to garrote myself with like everything else with a wire, including traditional earphones. - Bone conduction headphones sound ok and cost less, but tend to give me a headache after a few minutes. - The ear loops happened to fit me comfortably. On the other hand, my dad couldn't get them to stay in place. Disclaimer: I am not an audiophile and just wanted a set of bluetooth earphones that stay on while I'm on the move.
customer_reviews.author: Rloveswaffles

customer_reviews.title: Multiple issues, not balanced both sides
customer_reviews.text: I am big fan of Powerbeats and ordered Pro on very first day because of the style and convenient during my run. However it has multiple issues which has to be identified before release. 1.Both ears not synced multiple times. One earphone has delayed sync. I am facing this issue at least once in an hour of usage. 2.When you take out one side of Earphones, the sound is paused and need to play again. 3.lip sync delayed sometimes while watching streaming. All these issues expected and accepted for $25 worth of earphones not from $250 - Beats Pro Earphones .
customer_reviews.author: Mani

customer_reviews.title: Too Expensive
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with these overpriced headphones, when someone pays so much for device it has to be flawless and or very near. Sound quality wasn't must, I used a $33 Soundpeats True (which was louder,clearer and great balance) who would have thought. I can say though the battery life and connectivity was good. The case was a little big, and hard to carry at times to express the true wireless experience. Comfort was ok, and it had a decent seal . Overall I wait on the second version and or go with JLab Audio JBuds Air Sport True Wireless , similar design and at $69 is a MAJOR GO (Flossy Carter).
customer_reviews.author: Jon Blaze

customer_reviews.title: You Want These!
customer_reviews.text: Fingers crossed I never have to update my review with anything negative because I am OBSESSED with these and it’s only been one day! I have not taken them out of my ears all day. They have amazing sound, better than any headphones/ear buds I have ever used before. The noise is cancelled out fairly well. I also can’t wait to wear these to workout and not worry about them falling out of my ears!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Good design and sound quality, poor functionality with phone.
customer_reviews.text: Good product in terms of design and quality. What really annoys me is the iPhone integration. One of the earphones would not connect, or randomly disconnects while listening. To get it working again I have to take out the ginormous case, put both earpods back in, close the case, reopen and let it re-sync w the phone. Then MAYBE it'll work. If not, repeat. This sometimes takes me 3 min to get working again, which adding up gets really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Rawr

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted for 3 months of use
customer_reviews.text: TBH I loved these headphones, while they worked. After 2 months they started having connectivity issues. Could pull them out and it would only sink one side. Had to delete and re-pair with my iPhone. Not too big a deal. Then it started more frequently after that. I found out that you have to purposely leave the case open longer or they wouldn't pair with my phone. Then the right side started having trouble charging, and eventually stopped charging all together. I bought Apples extended warranty so I'll be able to replace them no issues, but for a $200 dollar item I expected much better. I would try the Samsung or Sony options in the price range before buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Croft

customer_reviews.title: MUST BUY! Not kidding!
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Lady Gaga Beats from about 11 years ago and they are still incredible and still work but I wanted to upgrade. I was a bit turned off by the price so I tried 2 other brands and and returned them both. Last night I decided to buy these and OF COURSE Beats did not disappoint. I cried when I put them in my ears and heard my music! There is NOTHING like them and I will always be a faithful customer. Please don’t ever change unless it’s to advance the technology! I would give these 10 stars! Well worth the $ because I know they’ll last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Shabana

customer_reviews.title: I thought I had found the perfect wireless earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I found these on Amazon when I wasn't looking. They are Power Beats so they have to be perfect, right? When I received them, I put them right in my ears. The sound was good & it was so awesome that they are totally wireless! After a week my left earbud would not charge. I tried & tried, but it wouldn't. So I turned to the internet. It wasn't uncommon for the Power Beats Pro to do this. I was one of the lucky ones that had it happen before the 30 day return ran out! Hope this helps all the people shopping for Power Beats Pro
customer_reviews.author: CindyH

customer_reviews.title: Promising...but falls short
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these at first because they don't fall out like so many other headphones do. But to get good sound quality, you really have to cram these things into your ear canal. Because of that, they weren't comfortable and although these don't fall out, they do move around in your ears quite a bit which affects sound quality. Battery life is decent but drains quickly when you aren't using them. And for the price, it really should have noise cancelling. Perhaps I'll get their next version depending on the features/comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: Feels like wearing a size smaller shoe, but in your ear.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sounded well and also great to handle phone calls. Almost as great as my Apple Pod Pros. Sadly, they hurt my ears after wearing them for more than an hour and I ended up returning them. The regular Apple pods did the same thing and that is why I use the Apple pod pros.
customer_reviews.author: JoMaMa

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t think I would like them.....
customer_reviews.text: Love the power ear Pro’s. At 68, I jog most every day - 4.3 miles, or so. Never thought I’d enjoy listening to music while jogging. Let me just say that these Powerbeats are amazing. My exercise is way more fun. The Powerbeats stay put. I easily get phone calls and the quality of music and calls is amazing. Powerbeats are not bothered by my copious perspiration. Easy care and easily connected to my iPhone. This is an amazing product. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jcr0306

customer_reviews.title: Look no further!
customer_reviews.text: Your search stops here. I was hesitant due to price, but these headphones are worth every penny! I don’t even care about the noise cancellation or sound quality, honestly. They’re beats, I expected nothing less. What I am most pleased about is how well they stay on my ear and how comfortable they are! I wanted a wireless headphone that was secure and comfortable, wouldn’t fall out when I’m running or doing any type of high impact exercising, and are water resistant due to sweat and/or rain. These gave me all of that and more. If you’re active, these are the headphones you need!
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey Haley

customer_reviews.title: Hurt my ears
customer_reviews.text: If I could send them back I would. I love the sound, the microphone works great and they are excellent for working out or conducting lots of phone calls hands-free. However, after about 20 minutes they just really hurt my ear and there is no way to adjust the fit. They are tight on the back of the ear and there isn't any way to alter the distance of the ring that wraps around the ear. Very disappointed with the fit, but otherwise a good headphone. Probably should have gone with the AirPods, but I was focused on work out headphones.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Smock

customer_reviews.title: First impressions
customer_reviews.text: Next day: I tried the Comply premium tips variety selection but couldn't get the same good, full sound as what I get from the ones that came with the ear buds... Recieved today: Took a few tries but found the right tips to get the full sound including magnificent bass and clarity. Very light and they do feel more secure in my ears than others I’ve tried. I wear glasses and no major issues with that. If you take one bud off it seems to stop playing. But you can press the remaining bud multipurpose button to resume. I also have them connected to my Fire TV cube. Sound is good and zero delay so far.
customer_reviews.author: IheartNetflix

customer_reviews.title: Left headphone stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I am really bummed about this product the left headphone button stopped working less than a month into having them and only one of them often connects when I take them out of the case these headphones are way more hassle than they are worth and I suggest looking elsewhere unfortunately I am 15 days outside of the return. These are not a reliable long-term product they will break and stop workingFor $200 I expect at least two or more years of full-time use with no problems
customer_reviews.author: Consciousbuyer

customer_reviews.title: By far, best pair of ear bud style headphones.
customer_reviews.text: The battery capacity for both the case and the ear pieces are impressive. Since updating the software through their app, I have had little to no issues with them. One thing that is very impressive is the entire frequency response range. I use these more than I have anticipated using them since they are very lightweight and do not fall out of your head if you are active. I am sort of an old fashioned buttons person, but on this set, it is impossible to have as many controls as I would like, but the ones they do have even using it with a non Apple product are sufficient and work well for me :)
customer_reviews.author: Trance

customer_reviews.title: In love with them!
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to get these for a deal! These are the earphones I wanted! The battery lasts a long time and the charging case does too. They stay in the ear no matter what. They have the technology to stop the music or whatever you’re watching, when you take out an earbud. Also, it shows you the battery life of each earbud if you’re only using one (ex. I only use the right earbud sometimes to hear my surroundings when doing something). I love them and I got them in the navy blue ones! I love the color! They also come with different ear cushions for different sized ears.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Painful after awhile/sound quality is poor/huge case
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always liked in ear headphones or earbuds. Every device I’ve ever used that had in ear tips have been great and never caused an issue. I could wear them all day no pain or discomfort. However the Powerbeats Pro starts to hurt after a very short time. The sound quality is surprisingly bad for a beats product. Even with the best fitting tips.... the sound is very muddled, and the max volume seems set to low. Music volume isn’t to bad, but things like audiobooks or podcasts can be way to low even at max volume.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy B.

customer_reviews.title: I actually bought my first "Apple" Product
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I broke down and bought an "Apple" product but man these Beats are amazing! I have used them a few times working out and they never move. Even drenched in sweat. The sound quality is great. I can't hear anything around me as I am working out. The only problem is adjusting the sound level with my Android. Sometimes there is a lag or it doesn't change the volume to the buds. Today the volume did seem softer than the last couple days also. So I will monitor that. But so happy with these compared to the cheap $25 pair I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: These are good earphones but they're not $200 good. I bought them because I have a fit issue with most earphones so I need the overear hook to keep the buds in place. That part works well. And once I got the right sized silicone tips on, the fit was pretty decent. But I didn't like the controls (any time I had to re-seat the buds, I'd invariably hit the pause or change the volume, there just isn't a way to touch them without pushing a button) and the sound quality is OK but not amazing for my novice ear. In the end, I returned them and went with a $30 pair that sounds fine and fits about the same.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great when they work
customer_reviews.text: I have so many issues connecting these to my phone and watch. At least twice a month I have to forget the device and reconnect them. Its frustrating when I am all set to go for a run and they will not connect to my watch. Takes 20 minutes to forget and reconnect. Wish Apple would make this system better. I had some powerbeats 2 that always connected. When I get them on and I'm running they are awesome. Sound good, comfortable, I'm able to just forget them.
customer_reviews.author: Elbow

customer_reviews.title: These no longer work with Garmin watches.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these headphones a few days ago. They initially worked great with my Garmin Fenix 5S plus watch. Then my iPad silently updated the headphones to firmware 2C48 and now the volume control no longer works. It's a known issue that has been a problem for almost a year, but I was hoping it was fixed by now. Unfortunately, it hasn't been fixed and Apple is ignoring the problem. Oh well. I will be returning them. I really wanted them to work.
customer_reviews.author: Jon V.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but clean before use.
customer_reviews.text: Ok, where do I begin? Uhh I always wait months after receiving items to review them. When I first got it and I connected to my iPhone it has somebody’s name instead of the “Powerbeats Pro” which means somebody definitely used it, when I unpacked it the item and the box looks used and really used. I ORDERED NEW... But it works really great, sound is great, noise canceling is ok, charge super fast and last very long, resistant to sweat. I’ve been using it for a long time now and it still going strong. Highly recommended, nonetheless. TIP: PLEASE CLEAN IT WELL WITH ALCOHOL WIPES BEFORE PUTTING IT IN YOUR EARS BECAUSE YOU DON’T KNOW WHERE ITS BEEN.
customer_reviews.author: Brewisna Beltinord

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: I have very small ear holes and haven't been able to find any type of earphones that won't fall ut or are so uncomfortable that I can't wear them. I ordered these with not a lot of hope but I am thrilled. I can now listen to anything without bothering anyone near me and that is the first time that has ever happened! I'm almost tempted to buy a second pair just to have them in case I lose these because I don't think I will find a better pair to fit me.
customer_reviews.author: jul

customer_reviews.title: Almost love them
customer_reviews.text: Wow these headphones are just 10x better than AirPods with the sound quality. I absolutely love the look of them they are so sleek and blend right in with my hair you can’t even tell I’m wearing them. The only con I have is that after a while my ears get really sore and I have to take them off. If only they would make the hard bud a bit smaller so my ears wouldn’t hurt. I have medium sized ears and they still hurt I can only imagine how someone with small ears would feel
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: These wireless earphones are the best.
customer_reviews.text: The earphones are great! They are comfortable on my ears and easy to use. Sound quality is perfect. I bought these because I am walking much more since Covid-19 and gym closures. I listen to Audible books and the miles pass quickly. Noise cancelling is great; I can easily hear cars approaching. The only problem I have is with electric bikes. They are silent and the riders use the sidewalks instead of the marked bike lanes in the street. Wonderful investment.
customer_reviews.author: H. Moser

customer_reviews.title: They did not hold up for more than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these wireless earphones mid-July for my husband to wear when he runs. After just 3 months of use, they have corroded on all metal parts. I contacted Apple support, sent them in for repair/replacement and was told the only option was to send them back “as is” to me or for me to purchase another pair. So much for sweat and water resistance as advertised by Apple. They could care less about fixing the issue. I DO NOT recommend these if you are purchasing them for an athlete.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The PowerBeats line just keeps getting better
customer_reviews.text: There’s over 21k reviews on this thing, for good reason. Apple has really stepped up with these truly wireless earphones. Not only are they stylish but great product overall. I upgraded from my wired powerbeats3 which itself is still going strong after 2.5 years. For background I workout nearly every day, sometimes 2x. Lots of plyometics/Crossfit things combined with small ears and sweating would make any other earphones fall off. Battery life is great, I’m never worried about it dying. Sound quality is amazing at least to a iPhone but I recognize it may not work as well with non-apple products. This is 100% worth every penny and will add quality to your workout
customer_reviews.author: Zoda

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these thinking they would provide great sound. They are no better than the ear buds that came FREE with my cell phone. The worst part is the lack of a battery life. After using then for 15 minutes, I have to charge then again. Sometimes one works, but the other one won't work as it needs more charging. I am sorry I bought them as they are a waste of money and totally useless.
customer_reviews.author: DWC

customer_reviews.title: Worst headphones ever.
customer_reviews.text: The worst sound of any headphones I’ve ever used. They make music painful. Do not buy. Why would anyone ever give these headphones a good review? This is crazy. Total crap, especially for the price and the hype. Uncomfortable, too. If these were the only headphones available in the universe, I would just stop listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: James B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound!!
customer_reviews.text: I was struggling with what earbuds to purchase. I have first generation AirPods and I am disabled and was having problems putting them in my ears without dropping them. So, I was going back-and-forth in my head do I want the beats or the airpro. What helped me in my choice is the battery life. I'm use to around four hours of use before a charge is needed and I wanted some thing longer lasting. The Powerbeats pro met the expectation and the sound is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Luvinitguy

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these unless you want to be disappointed. That the sound is not very good I can live with. That the connection drops I cannot. I bought these specifically for running, especially runs lasting several hours. I have not had one run where the connection did not drop. Yes, resetting them fixes the problem temporarily but they can only be reset in their very bulky and heavy case. Taking it along on a run completely defeats the point of buying expensive bluetooth headphones. I am back to using my cabled cans that have better sound and cost less than a quarter of what these cost.
customer_reviews.author: Hanno Stamm

customer_reviews.title: Great if you like headphones that last 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these twice; both times, one of the ears went out on me. This is maddening. The sound quality is decent for in-ear wireless, and these are relatively comfortable, though not great if you're prone for laying on your side and listening to music (ouch!). They pinch if worn for long periods of time, but stay in place. They look sharp, and the phone/sound quality is quite good. BUT THEY JUST DO NOT LAST. Either I got two lemons or these things are a big fat waste of money. Enjoy them while they last, friends...
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Bluetooth Wireless headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a pair of these awhile back and they were so good that I purchased this pink pair for my wife. My wife was using them for running, but I have noticed she uses them now to talk on the phone so she has her hands free to do other thinks like cooking. The feel on these are amazing. Sometimes they hurt my ear a little bit but I just rotate them more into my ear and the pain goes away instantly. Great product!!!
customer_reviews.author: 49erJoe

customer_reviews.title: Not for Windows!
customer_reviews.text: These are great with my Android phone. They are comfortable, they stay put, and they sound good. Unfortunately for those of us who do not partake of the Apple, they are iOS-centric and do not work with Windows devices. As I require cross-platform functionality, these are going back and the search for good, truly wireless ear buds continues. Can I just add that Apple and their minions irk the yipes out of me with their "iOS or bust" attitude?
customer_reviews.author: PsychReader

customer_reviews.title: What a nice set of wireless buds!
customer_reviews.text: So first of all I am a huge beats fan and have about 5 different pairs. I have enjoyed the powerbeats line up for years but was waiting until they finally came out without wires! I do have AirPods as well but I can't keep them in my ears. I dont work out so I didn't need these for working out I needed them for wireless buds that wouldn't fall out and I found them!!! Great quality! In my opinion stronger than the AirPods. 5 STARS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pat Cain

customer_reviews.title: Better than air pods
customer_reviews.text: These earphones have excellent sound quality. They also are significantly more useful than air pods because they have easy-to-use volume and pause/answer call capability. Best of all, the Powerbeats readily stay on my ears, which air pods never did. I have used the Powerbeats while biking and in the gym, and they stay in place with no issues. Air pods ended up being much more expensive because I had to buy new ones whenever the darn things fell out and got lost in public places. It is true the Powerbeats carrying case is significantly bulkier than the air pod case, but that is only a minor negative.
customer_reviews.author: Chevy Chase, MD

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't going to buy airpods since they provide little external noise isolation and to me they just look goofy. So been waiting for the price of the powerbeats pro to drop, then bam, placed the order. Didn't know what to expect based on the mixed reviews. First impressions: very pleased with them. Comfort, sound, and looks are great. Really, like the user friendly volume controls and pause features that are on both buds. As some other reviewers mentioned, it is very important to try the different size tips. I found the larger ones resulted in the heavy bass that I prefer. So right now these work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great features....poor sound
customer_reviews.text: Beats features are great. HOWEVER.....the earbuds lack midrange. The sound is relatively tinny. I'm not sure why but I think the sound on my apple airpods is far better. I used the alternate powerbeats small ear tips but that didn't do it. There is a Iot of commentary about the need for a tight fit for better sound. They are secure with the loops. You can buy silicone loops for airpods which I have so they're equally secure. I wish there were better controls on the airpods. But sound rules....so I am sending these powerbeats back.
customer_reviews.author: Robert  F. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Could be great EarPods, but...
customer_reviews.text: Initially, these were very uncomfortable because I have small ear canals. I was going to return them, but after trying them more, the discomfort became less of an issue. I love them-or, I did love them. After several weeks, sound started cutting off in one or the other EarPods. Then, even after fully charged, one or the other would not work. I spent 45 min with a tech phone call going through all the steps to correct problems. They still don’t work right, and I’m terribly disappointed that $200 later, I cannot depend on them. I’ve not been able to contact a tech again, and Apple store too far away. Bummer. Apple get your act together please!!
customer_reviews.author: Birmom

customer_reviews.title: What AirPods should be...
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't you know it, I bought these for me and the wife a month before Apple came out with the AirPods Pro with noise canceling. Noise canceling is one of those things you think you don't need until you try it. The only people who don't need noise cancelation are people who listen to music in a totally quiet environment. But these don't claim to be noise canceling, so they absolutely do what they are supposed to do, and do it beautifully. I love these earphones, and you will too. Until you try ones with noise cancelation....D'OH!
customer_reviews.author: Steve613

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: I have had these wireless earbuds for a little over a year now, and I recommend them to anyone who likes to listen to music while doing different physical activities. They are a little pricey but worth it. Everything I wanted in a pair of earphones these beats had( Great battery life, Wireless connection, Decent Bluetooth range, effortless Bluetooth connection especially with other apple products, ear hook, etc.) If you have a little extra cash and are looking for a pair of wireless earbuds for the gym or any physical activities with good battery life, and that want fall out of your ears I recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Best gym headphones by far!
customer_reviews.text: These are a beast in the gym (me included). They stayed in place for the whole workout and didn't budge at all. The Powerbeats3 were great also but I constantly had to keep readjusting them because of that annoying cord behind my neck, which would pull either earbud away from my ear. These have NO cord so you're free to do all the insane workouts you want without worry of them falling off. Sound quality is PERFECT. Battery life is one of the best in the market Price is a bit much but it's worth the extra penny. Get you a pair! You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: If you are on the fence, this is the sign that you have been waiting for.
customer_reviews.text: I think you should try these headphones. I love them. I used to only buy Bose but I really wanted a truly wireless headphone that I could run in and wouldn’t fall out of my freakishly small ears. The charging and connection to my iPhone was as easy as it gets, they don’t slip out of my ears no matter how sweaty or bouncy I get and the interface with my iPhone is intuitive and flawless. The sound is great for music and podcasts. The controls are super easy to use. I am so in love with these headphones they make me want to use them more and more...which I can because the battery life is quality! Life is good.
customer_reviews.author: Darius

customer_reviews.title: Bring a wired failsafe or other BT headphones
customer_reviews.text: At this pricepoint my expectation is that I take bith ear buds out of the case and they work. I started hiking with them on but with no music. I got to turn on the music and find that only one works. Case is in the car. No obvious indicator that both charged properly and it is not possible to unpair and repair without the case. My inexpensive bluetooth earphones have charge indicators on each bud and pair without difficulty. I got beats to improve sounds quality and fit, but this mono ear situation is not an improvement and I'm not fittin to play tech support prior to every use.
customer_reviews.author: NB.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Bother... Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: These do not live up to the hype! I purchased these to use while working, so that I can listen to music and take calls on the compute. The call audio quality was horrible. Coworkers commented that I sounded far away and was not clear. I've also had to deal with these being painful, leaving blisters, dropping connection, one stop working while still connected, one getting a few seconds ahead of the other while playing music, and of course not properly connecting to a new laptop. I'm done trying to troubleshoot the problems and will be returning these. Maybe a future version will be better suited for me.
customer_reviews.author: ModernDayOldSoul

customer_reviews.title: Powerbeats Pro vs Powerbeats 3
customer_reviews.text: This was my dilemma after owning Powerbeats for the last 3 years. I finally splurged and copped the Powerbeats Pro about 6 weeks ago. Here are my thoughts... -Powerbeats 3 appear to be louder -Pros are much more comfortable -Pros new design really does fit in your ears so much better. -Mic for phone calls is excellent -Pros case is disappointingly big but that’s okay. Not a dealbreaker for me If you’re on the fence and need good exercise Bluetooth earbuds, you don’t be disappointed. There are buts out there with better overall sound but the combination of sound, phone calls, comfort and just ease of wearing them make it a terrific purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: Poet Granderson

customer_reviews.title: I (still) hate these
customer_reviews.text: I bought these when they first came out and I was so excited about them. Sound quality was a big improvement over the previous powerbeats. They're also stay in place better and are more comfortable. But the good ends there. I have constant disconnection problems, and constant charging problems. The left pod is very difficult to seat properly into the charger. What a hassle getting to the gym and putting in the pods, only to realize only one had charged. I tried another set and they also had the same problem--and the connection issue was actually even worse. I repeatedly had to remove them and reconnect them to my phone! Apple can do better.
customer_reviews.author: tommy-d

customer_reviews.title: Not loud enough
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment. I was hoping to use these at the gym but the volume, even at its highest setting, does not get loud enough. Back to the $25 wireless headphones with the cord around the back of the neck. Returning today
customer_reviews.author: Knebz

customer_reviews.title: I have been reborn!
customer_reviews.text: I had been using Power Beats for a few years and inadvertently left them in my shorts which went through the wash thereby ruining them. I purchased the Pro Wireless and entered an whole new and fantastic world! No more wire behind my neck and so many fantastic features including Siri, great microphone, automatic "shut off" when removing from ears etc. etc. I can honestly say the price differential was really worth it. Highly recommend this great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: These have good sound and battery life but they did not work for me. The flat part at the bottom sits on my ear in a way that becomes incredibly painful after about an hour. I changed out all the ear buds that come with it but none made it better. The only other issue I had was that the case is really big so you can’t just put it in your pocket. Despite the good points I had to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: My favorite earbuds to date!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd set of these, and I love them! The reason I got another set is because one of them in my last pair stopped holding a charge for more than an hour. I've heard that this has happened to other people too. Even considering this flaw, I love them! Most totally wireless buds these days don't have all necessary controls on the bud itself. This is a deal breaker for me because I don't want to have to pull my phone out or ask an assistant every time I want to turn the volume up. I also love that they work independent of eachother, and all controls are on each one.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly carmichael

customer_reviews.title: Caution, causes a rash in some cases!
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping these would work. I already bought the Bose sport earbuds but they fall out like crazy. These stay in very well and sound good too. Great for working out. However, every time I wear them I get a horrible rash inside my ear and over the back, wherever they are touching. I looked it up online and there are many people with this type of allergy. Rash is itchy, burns and discharges a fluid. Takes about 5-7 days to go away and if you wear them again it comes back immediately. If you buy them and feel any irritation send them back before it’s too late.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Pow pow in my ears
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT!! especially cus it's pink! Bass is good enough at least for me. Sound is great and connected to my iPhone right away. I was surprised the charger was thunder lightning bolt tho Instead of usb c. Apple trying real hard to not go with usb c -_- anyways great product just got it today. Def an upgrade to my d wireless beats. Also freaking awesome when listening to asmr!!
customer_reviews.author: Bam Bam

customer_reviews.title: Awful Connectivity. Nice Design but Bad Quality
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have a lot of connectivity issues. Sometimes one of them randomly stops playing while the other continues. No real reason other than them being defective. Then you have to disconnect them and go through the whole process of pairing them again. Has happened at the gym which was very distracting. It's really not a quality product. They might look nice but not worth even half of what you pay for them.
customer_reviews.author: k1000a

customer_reviews.title: They are just alright for the price
customer_reviews.text: If these were cheaper I'd recomend them. With music they sound great, especially for base, but people talking I'd expect it to sound better. It has a wide range with Bluetooth. I can listen to music and walk around the house pretty well. Some times its really hard to connect them to the devices. I open and close the case, click the pairing button. I followed the instructions but sometimes it's just annoying. They hurt my ears after wearing them for over an hour, and they hurt my fiance too. They sounds overall great, and perfect for working out. I just think they would be worth it for 100-150 instead....
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: They are beats what can I say
customer_reviews.text: Other than Bose , beats is the one, sounds is just awesome, everything on this is awesome Trust me I try many, but I have been using Bose for a long time, so I got used to crisps deep sound. If you have not been exposed to that, this are too expensive, there are other out there. I got two others I did a review for and they are good. Very good. So if you have the cash go for it, if you don’t check out my other reviews. Remember: It cost money.! Because it saves money.! Sorry I had to do it lol
customer_reviews.author: rewreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Apple Devices but more complicated for other devices like Kindle
customer_reviews.text: The product works great but I do have an issue when I attach it to a Kindle. I have to go through several steps to connect the Powerbeats to the Kindle each time I want to use them, when previous non-Apple earbuds connected immediately every time. I think the problem relates to the fact that they only attach to one device at a time. The Powerbeats attach to Apple devises immediately and with ease.
customer_reviews.author: DL Ward

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I got these paired with a Samsung Galaxy s9plus. Sound quality is fantastic. I love the independent functionality of these, I am a bus mechanic and my normal days are 10 hours (hopefully). I only wear one at work for safety reasons. I start at 3:30 am and I have been able to get through my entire day listening to music and talking on the phone by the time I get in my car I still have 30% or better depending on how loud I had them I normally keep the volume i would say a little over 25% in volume for me to hear the music or calls. When talking on them the call sound quality is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Could have been a great product but charger isn’t reliable
customer_reviews.text: This would have been a great product except for the poor charger design. Only after 5 months of use the charger contacts and the earbud contacts started to wear off and oxidize. You will see the green oxidation over time as the outer metal coating wears off. Another peeve I have with this charger is the charger-side metal contacts are really short. It makes it hard to make good contact with the earbuds. I had to go to Apple support to get a replacement. They asked for $350 of deposit upfront as a collateral. I paid $200 for the original product so this doesn’t make sense Apple.
customer_reviews.author: K. Le

customer_reviews.title: Love the pink
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the pink color it’s so pretty and the design it’s perfect for me they fit just right and I can run, cook, ride my bike and do pretty much anything and they will stay on, battery life lasts a long time, the only reason why I took 2 star away is because they keep disconnecting from my phone and I have to take them off and put them back in the box and try again, it started a couple of weeks ago and the time for exchange is up. So it would nice that for such expensive items they would give you some more time for exchange and return
customer_reviews.author: Katia P.

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient, love them!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Beats for years and haven’t been disappointed yet. I love these, I previously had the Powerbeats 3 and loved those. I actually at one point wished that they were completely wireless and then months later these were released. The sound quality is really good and noise cancellation. A bit pricey to be honest but I’m glad I got them, no more cords getting caught up in my locks. 🤦🏽‍♀️😂
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: Did not pair!
customer_reviews.text: Establishing a connection between two Bluetooth devices. For example, to pair a PowerBeats with may iphone, when the phone is configured to "Discoverable" mode and the headset is set up to pair by pressing one or more keys for some number of seconds, should be easy. I tried every Bluetooth device in the house to connect to the Powerbeats with no luck. Sending them back for a refund,,,, I hope. Also, I read the serial number to a Apple online Rep and she said they were out of Warranty,,, how that be I just purchased them days ago!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable charging, average at best sound quality
customer_reviews.text: The headphones charge using contacts that are near the base of each headphone. If you don’t carefully place the headphones perfectly they won’t charge. This means I’m constantly checking my phone to see if they are actually charging. Nothing is worse than popping these in before your workout only to have one for 3 minutes in. As for the sound quality, I expected better. These sound no better than $20 skull candy buds. Overall save your money until Apple/beats get it together and release a decent over the ear option.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Rash
customer_reviews.text: I have to say these are by far the best air buds I’ve ever purchased and stay in my ears however since I purchased them my ears have become red and irritated and developed a rash. I researched on the Internet and it appears several others have had the same problem I’m so disappointed. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: not worth the price. Sound extremely disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I am a music and audio enthusiastic. If it sounds good I pay the price. I have a nice over the ear set for $250 and would not want to miss the dynamic range in a good set of headphones. I just purchased a set of three true wireless earbuds, including this set. the conclusion is that they sound just as good as $50 set. Very disappointed with weak bass and the extreme focus on mid and high range. Unacceptable for a product that costs $250. PS: these sound just as good for $50  returned.
customer_reviews.author: DerAusgewanderte

customer_reviews.title: Unlike the Air Pods, or Samsung, or Bose these stay in your ears ...
customer_reviews.text: Had new version of Air Pods work out heavy at the Gym they kept falling out of my ears, bought rubber wraps to keep them in didn't work - sent them back... Bought these and they are FANTASTIC, stay in ears, sound quality is better then Air Pods and they come with different ear size cups to change out to your ear size, magnetic charger, only drawback is the size of the case vs the Air Pods - other than that they would be PERFECT ... Don't hesitate if your thinking about them extra cost is well worth it if you work out wearing ear buds ...
customer_reviews.author: Zorro

customer_reviews.title: Required After Market Tips for Me-Great Results After
customer_reviews.text: I was initially disappointed with the sound quality and noise isolation when I first got these, and I was contemplating whether to keep them. I realized that I just wasn't getting the best seal with the stock tips. After trying a few after market tip options, I found the Spinfit CP360s. Noise isolation and sound quality are greatly improved now. Sound quality is very good for truly wireless, but truly wireless does have its sound quality limits.Bluetooth connection has been rock solid. Battery life is good. These are a great workout option. If the stock tips were better, these would be five stars.
customer_reviews.author: C. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, comfortable, long charge
customer_reviews.text: I switched to these after my Samsung galaxy buds quit working. At first I didn't like them as much as the buds, but now I love them. They are very comfortable around my ears and they never fall off. They have yet to die on me and I rarely charge the case. The sound is great also. They connect quickly and I really enjoy them on long runs and skates.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it or Apple wants the AirPods to shine
customer_reviews.text: The PowerBeats Pro sound quality is a joke, it's sound playback reproduction is similar tho any free or $5 in-ear sets. There is absolutely no bass, no treble. Ear canal seal is missing as well. At this point Apple's AirPods just shine. Was this product released to make warning to any competition about "superiority" of Apple products? I think so. The set is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: masfet

customer_reviews.title: Rash
customer_reviews.text: They work great. Easy to use. I have used them for about 4 months then all of a sudden my ears started getting a rash, itchy and swollen. I constantly clean them. So I did not use for about 2 weeks. My ears started to clear up. So I used them again. By the next today the rash was back. I do not have a allergy to latex since I use latex gloves daily. Not sure what the heck is going on but I can’t use them.
customer_reviews.author: MtnCrabb39

customer_reviews.title: Love these more than my Airpods!
customer_reviews.text: Pros! - Fits my ears great, but does come with extra buds. - Feels secure - Sleek design - Great sound - Awesome battery life. I charged it once when I got it, used it for 1-2 weeks at the gym (4-6 days, 1.5hrs) and then had to charge it again. Cons! - It becomes slightly uncomfortable/sore pressing against the middle cartilage of my ear when I wear them for too long. I'm usually at the gym between 1.5 to 2 hours, so not sure if that's a long or short time for some people - Takes a little bit to get them on, gotta find your own way to quickly put them in but, not a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: Valarie

customer_reviews.title: Not sure yet
customer_reviews.text: I'm really surprised at how poor the audio quality is for voice. I use earbuds for many hours a day listening to podcasts and audible books, so voice quality is very important to me. Right now, it simply sound tinny. There is no way to adjust amount of treble, etc. For this amount of money, it's really disappointing. I'm not sure yet whether I'll return these. My AirPods, which have better sound for my purposes, tend to fall out of my left ear unless I'm being very level-headed.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Hinman

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless earbuds...
customer_reviews.text: Love these earbuds. They don’t cancel out noise, but I prefer this since I wear them outside running. I enjoy the sound quality and the ability to wear them one at a time. Easily skip to the next music track by double tapping one easily accessible button. Only complaint is they’re not the best for yoga. In instances where you need to turn your head to the side while lying down it can pause/unpause your video due to the location of the button for this feature.
customer_reviews.author: amanda brown

customer_reviews.title: They won't come off until you take them off.
customer_reviews.text: The Powerbeat Pro's are great but I did run into a little problem with them. The left ear piece was finicky on how it wanted to be seated in the case for charging. Sometimes the left one would not charge until I gave it a slight nudge. So after noticing this issue (I purchased them in November of 2019) I had a chat with Amazon CS. After explaining my complaint they asked me if a replacement would resolve the issue. So after 3 months of product use I returned the faulty pair and they immediately sent out a new replacement. HOW'S THAT FOR CUSTOMER SERVICE. Thank you Amazon. You make all our purchases so smooth and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Painful to wear for more than a few minutes
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately the problem is not correctable by bending the flexible behind-the-ears elements, and changing the size of the in-ear inserts does not improve this (at least for me). The earpiece is designed so that it stays in by wedging the ear canal piece (on the left in the pic) against the conch of the ear piece using the "base" (on the right). The combination of the angle and the distance is what makes these headphones unbearable to wear for anything past few minutes for me. Yup, will be returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Zawadzki

customer_reviews.title: great ear buds for people who hate ear buds
customer_reviews.text: I hate ear buds. I have tried several different ones and could never find a pair that fit comfortably in my ears. On a lark, I tried these buds on Prime day. I figured I had 30 days to return them if I didn't like them so why not give them a try. They fit great and are really comfortable. The sound quality is amazing and I enjoy using them to make phone calls. I also wear them while doing yoga. The battery seems to last forever. I am really happy with these buds and would recommmend them to anyone who doesn't wear glasses.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I had the Powerbeats3 for a couple of years and I really wanted to love these. The case is massive and not really pocketable. They also charge over lightning instead of USB C, which I could've forgiven if they managed to put in wireless charging. I don't understand how they made a product $50 more and 3x the size of the AirPods but they couldn't put wireless charging in the case. They do sound much better than the old model. Overall, not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: SupermanCK

customer_reviews.title: best sports headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried many different headphones for listening to audiobooks, podcasts, and music while running. These are by far the best for me. They are also the most expensive out of those I've tried but absolutely worth every penny. I have small ears and most in-ear headphones rarely fit me. Those that do, feel like a heavy intrusion. Powerbeats Pro feel amazingly well, do not move once fitted, and so comfortable I forget I have them on. The sound quality is wonderful. They are super easy to pair with your devices and very simple to use. Would give 6 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Anna S

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, Iffy product
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the earphones are great. The sound is good and great for running/ working out. A low rating is simply for the connection/ charging issues. Numerous times I have gone to workout thinking my headphones were fully charged but in actuality, the headphones weren't "connected" and therefore dead. Another problem I have experienced is the Bluetooth connection issues. When connecting to an Apple Watch, sometimes only one earbud will connect. Actually, all of the time only one earbud will connect. Good product but comes with its fair share of frustrations.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Save your MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe how many good reviews are on here for these. First off, they are not comfortable. Even with buying memory foam tips. Sound quality is so-so. Noise cancellation is non exinsistant. I matched up against my old pair of Ankers. Not even a comparison. Save your money. But a pair on Ankers for $35.
customer_reviews.author: led106

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and even better customer experience
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these headphones in June when they just came out. The sound quality is excellent, so is the noise canceling capacity. Which is exactly what I’m looking for when I’m running at the gym. My first pair started malfunctioning almost immediately after purchase, but attributed that to improper charging.... wrong they were just bum set of buds. So I called Amazon30 days after my return window closed, and they exchanged them for me! Thanks Amazon you’re awesome!
customer_reviews.author: beata sherman

customer_reviews.title: The battery life is impressive
customer_reviews.text: That's the only good thing I can say about the power beats pro.the hook is good, fully adjustable.but the ear tip won't won't stay in my ear.I finally had to buy some wings to the ear tips in my ear.without the wings,I keep losing that sweet spot which has the full rich sound that music like.noise isolation is terrible you have to turn them up loud to block out unwanted noise around you.I could mention about 3 other things I don't like about them,but I'm doing that much writing.they are good to sleep with long battery life and won't fall off your ears while you sleep.
customer_reviews.author: jimmy c.

customer_reviews.title: Love these excellent performers!
customer_reviews.text: Sounds absolutely smooth and detailed. If you prefer heavier bass like I do, these will satisfy. The controls are user friendly, and they stay in place. I have four different earbuds and I am a music buff - - these passed my strict demands in sound, user friendliness, and Form factor. People have different taste and hearing, so just because it doesn't sound good to a few individuals, you have to look at the majority. Also check a couple of profiles - - competition :) Overall a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: JAZZY62

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: I have the worst luck with earbuds. I have gone through about 20. I run and sweat a lot and either they don’t fit my small ears or they break within a month due to the sweat and hard use during exercise. These are not like the others. They fit in my very small ears and they haven’t broken yet. I would recommend these. They are also very easy to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Shanna Sciola

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones, now in some sweet colors
customer_reviews.text: The glacier blue is a little girlier than I thought, but it’s also a subtle color that isn’t too flashy. Keeping them, looks better than the black (at least for those with blonde hair).
customer_reviews.author: Mathew S.

customer_reviews.title: Painful
customer_reviews.text: I can't wear the Powerbeats Pro because the hard nub that the ear bud fits onto is too large for my ear and after an hour or so my ear is VERY painful. I have the Powerbeats with the red wire and can wear them all day long without any pain. I'm VERY disappointed that I will not be able to wear the Pro. Also the ear piece that fits behind my ear is VERY narrow adding to the pressure from behind and into my ear causing pain on both sides of my ear.
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy

customer_reviews.title: Good product at a terribly optimistic price.
customer_reviews.text: Good: Battery Life. Sound quality. Charging time. Perfect for high-mobility workouts. Good quality construction. Bad: personally, it hurt my ears if worn for more than an hour. Sometimes the headphones won’t fully connect to the case and not charge. TOO expensive. $100 is too much money to pay over AirPods for more battery life and better moisture wicking. And to be quite honest, they don’t sounds any better than AirPods.....disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Cisco

customer_reviews.title: Good but not the best.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I thought having the extra feature going around my ear would prevent it from falling out when I sweat but that is false. If you sweat, this falls out just like every other headphone. Volume levels are quite low and sound quality is good .. but I’m definitely returning and gonna try out the airpods pro because this is yet another headphone that doesn’t stay in my ear.
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Love these but took some breaking in
customer_reviews.text: I switched from AirPods to these a few months ago and I honestly love them. I was constantly accidentally knocking the AirPods out of my ears and they didn't cancel any noise out. I love that these go over my ears and are decent at noise cancelling. However!! They take some breaking in. I almost returned them when I first got them because they hurt my ears so badly - like if a headband was too tight behind your ears. But you can adjust the over-the-ear part and they eventually break in and are super comfortable. Just be patient.
customer_reviews.author: Dani King

product_meta.title: Powerbeats Pro Wireless Earphones - Apple H1 Headphone Chip, Class 1 Bluetooth, 9 Hours Of Listening Time, Sweat Resistant Earbuds - Moss
feature_bullets: Totally wireless high-performance earphones in moss
Up to 9 hours of listening time (more than 24 hours with charging case)
Adjustable, secure-fit ear hooks for lightweight comfort and stability
Reinforced design for sweat & water resistance during tough workouts or running
Volume & track controls on each earbud, voice capability, and auto play/pause
Features the Apple H1 headphone chip and Class 1 Bluetooth for extended range and fewer dropouts
Enhanced phone call performance and call handling from either earbud
With fast fuel, a 5-minute charge gives 1.5 hours of playback when battery is low
What's in the box: Powerbeats Pro totally wireless earphones, charging case, ear tips with four size options, lightning to USB-A charging cable, quick start guide, warranty card
